sentence: beyond its important technical contributions, this work showed that the insights and methods of the rational expectations revolution could be applied to models with sticky wages and prices.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: the rational expectations revolution helped to kill the idea of a long-run tradeoff between the levels of inflation and unemployment.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: however, john's analysis showed that, in the presence of aggregate supply shocks, attempts by monetary policymakers to reduce the volatility of inflation over time could be associated with higher volatility in unemployment, and vice versa.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: interestingly, john's work anticipated the possibility that improvements in the conduct of monetary policy or changes in the structure of the economy could result in a shift of the taylor curve--that is, a change in the ability of policy to smooth both inflation and employment.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: and indeed, what economists have dubbed the great moderation--a simultaneous reduction in the volatility of inflation and the volatility of real economic activity--has occurred in the united states and in many other economies over the past quarter-century.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: over the course of the 1980s, john continued his work on rational expectations issues and monetary policy and macroeconomics more generally.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: among other problems, significant pressures on bank balance sheets were beginning to emerge that would damp economic growth for the next several years.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: that essay laid the foundation for what is perhaps john's most well-known contribution to economics--the simple description of the determinants of monetary policy that eventually became known as the taylor rule.1 john's analysis triggered an avalanche of studies examining the stabilization properties of taylor rules in the context of macroeconomic models.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: other work investigated the ability of variants of the taylor rule to describe empirically the actual course of monetary policy in the united states and in other economies.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: the taylor rule also embeds a basic principle of sound monetary policy that has subsequently been referred to as the taylor principle.2 according to this principle, when a shock causes a shift in the inflation rate, the central bank must adjust the nominal interest rate by more than one-for-one.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: this ensures that the real interest rate moves in the right direction to restore price stability.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: the taylor principle provides essential guidance for central banks on how to anchor long-run inflation expectations and foster stable growth and low inflation.

sentence: but he has argued that such rules can serve as useful benchmarks for the practical conduct of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: in fact, policymakers at the federal reserve and many other central banks do routinely consult various policy rules as they make judgments on the appropriate stance of monetary policy.

sentence: i'm sure that, in between teaching and guiding the work of graduate students, he will continue to offer insightful commentary on monetary policy and other economic issues.
